title: veso27
author: veso27
content: I want to sell an nft of some ugly monkey that my little cousin won at a giveaway a while back because we are in desperate need of the money but the fee that is required is higher than i can afford right now. Im willing to split the nft 70/30 and give you the money back for the fee because i really need the money to pay our rent.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: veso27 on May 17, 2022, 01:42:17 PMI want to sell an nft of some ugly monkey that my little cousin won at a giveaway a while back because we are in desperate need of the money but the fee that is required is higher than i can afford right now. Im willing to split the nft 70/30 and give you the money back for the fee because i really need the money to pay our rent. How you can be sure that you will sell your NFT in a short time? even if you get a loan, you have no guarantee that you will sell it before the time comes to pay the rent.Also, you don't offer valid collateral, so this will not be able to happen to someone who has just registered, only to ask for free money. I suggest you try to find other sources to pay your rent.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: veso27 on May 17, 2022, 01:42:17 PMI want to sell an nft of some ugly monkey that my little cousin won at a giveaway a while back because we are in desperate need of the money but the fee that is required is higher than i can afford right now. Im willing to split the nft 70/30 and give you the money back for the fee because i really need the money to pay our rent. You think selling an NFT is similar to selling the usual tokens that have value that you can just deposit in an exchange and trade?Who do you think is going to buy your ugly monkey NFT in the shortest time possible, more over at even a higher price than the gas fees?You are not going to receive that money. Try somewhere else.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: fenican on May 18, 2022, 04:51:38 AMSCAM LIKELY lol.You mean someone who can afford a several hundred thousand dollar NFT wouldn't have problems paying a $30 network fee to list it for sale?  I might have to agree there...  Especially since they could literally just accept the highest offer on their NFT and get paid in WETH, thereby avoiding the fee altogether.OP, I'll help you out if you need it.  Just transfer the monkey NFT to my wallet and I'll take care of it for you.  I'll even give you an extra 10% and we can split it 80/20.
